Overview

Diplomatic pulse is a crawling, indexing and storage system for United Nations Member States: released statements in Real Time.

It should provide much of the structure and parsing code needed to crawl and scrape webpages contents in Ministry of Foreign Affairs MFA with very little effort. On launching the Diplomatic pulse crawlers, the system clones our existing website xpaths data: xpaths of each country’s website to crawl and scrape html contents.

Why Diplomatic pulse

The press statements of each United Nations (UN) Member State are the primary sources on issues of debate in the UN’s peace and security context. to automate this, we have developed the Diplomatic pulse system as search engine service for all press statements of the UN Member States, including their Foreign Ministries and Permanent Missions to the UN.

It is built using free open source website crawling technologies which is Scrapy framework.

Who are using Diplomatic pulse

The United Nations Member States including the United Nations Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs (DPPA) are using Diplomatic pulse.
